project.name: Ember JSON API Resources
project.description: Lightweight persistence for an Ember CLI app using the JSON API 1.0 specification.

adapter.name: adapter
adapter.description: Adapter for a JSON API endpoint, use as a service for your backend

store.name: store
store.description: Service for a JSON API endpoint a facade to your resource adapter

cache.name: cache
cache.description: A Mixin class for caching JSON API resource objects

resource.name: resource
resource.description:
A Resource class to create JSON API resource objects

See <http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects>

serializer.name: serializer
serializer.description: Serializer/Deserializer for a JSON API resource object, used by adapter

ApplicationAdapter.name: ApplicationAdapter
ApplicationAdapter.description: Adapter for a JSON API endpoint, use as a service for your backend

ServiceCacheMixin.name: ServiceCacheMixin
ServiceCacheMixin.description: A Mixin class for caching JSON API resource objects

Resource.name: Resource
Resource.description:
A Resource class to create JSON API resource objects

See <http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects>

RelatedProxyUtil.name: RelatedProxyUtil
RelatedProxyUtil.description: Mixin for creating promise proxy objects for related resources

ApplicationSerializer.name: ApplicationSerializer
ApplicationSerializer.description: Serializer/Deserializer for a JSON API resource object, used by adapter

StoreService.name: StoreService
StoreService.description: Service for a JSON API endpoint a facade to your resource adapter

classitems.description: The name of the entity
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: The url for the entity, e.g. /posts or /api/v1/posts
classitems.name: url

classitems.description: Find resource(s) using an id or a using a query `{id: '', query: {}}`
classitems.name: find

params.name: options
params.description: use a string for a single id or an object

classitems.description:
Find a resource by id, optionally pass a query object, e.g. w/ filter param(s)

Uses a url like: /photos/1
classitems.name: findOne

classitems.description: Find resources using an optional query object, e.g. w/ pagination params
classitems.name: findQuery

classitems.description:
Find resources using an optional query object, e.g. w/ pagination params

A Url like: /photos/1/relationships/photographer is a required param
classitems.name: findRelated

params.name: resource
params.description: name (plural) to lookup the service object w/ serializer

classitems.description: Create a new resource, sends a POST request
classitems.name: createResource

params.name: the
params.description: resource instance to serialize

classitems.description:
Patch an existing resource, sends a PATCH request. After promise is resolved
the `didUpdateResource` event is triggered, resource may listen on their
`service` reference
classitems.name: updateResource

params.name: the
params.description: resource instance to serialize the changed attributes

classitems.description:
Patch a relationship, either add or remove, sends a PATCH request

Adds with payload: `{ "data": { "type": "comments", "id": "12" } }`
Removes with payload: `{ "data": null }`
classitems.name: patchRelationship

params.name: the
params.description: resource instance, has URLs via it's relationships property

params.name: resource
params.description: name (plural) to find the url from the resource instance

classitems.description: Delete an existing resource, sends a DELETE request
classitems.name: deleteResource

params.name: the
params.description: name (plural) or resource instance w/ self link

classitems.description:
Makes a fetch request via Fetch API

see http://updates.html5rocks.com/2015/03/introduction-to-fetch
classitems.name: fetch

classitems.description:
Adds params and headers or Fetch request.

For example a header is set for Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json

If an `AuthorizationHeader` key exists in localStorage it will be used for
the `Authorization` header value.
classitems.name: fetchOptions

classitems.description:
Hook to customize the URL, e.g. if your API is behind a proxy and you need
to swap a portion of the domain to make a request on the same domain.
classitems.name: fetchUrl

classitems.description:
Noop as a hook for defining how deserialized resource objects are cached,
e.g. in memory
classitems.name: cacheResource

params.name: resp
params.description: w/ props: {Object} meta, {Array|Object} data, & {Object} headers

classitems.description:
Initialize events to communicate on the resource instances' service reference.
Listens for resource objects trigging `attributeChanged` events
classitems.name: initEvents

classitems.description: Initializer for the store service, injects into the route and controller
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description: Cache object
classitems.name: cache

classitems.description: Initialize a cache object
classitems.name: initCache

classitems.description: Store response object(s) in the cache
classitems.name: cacheResource

params.name: resp
params.description: w/ props: {Object} meta, {Array|Object} data, & {Object} headers

classitems.description: Store meta data in the cache
classitems.name: cacheMeta

params.name: resp
params.description: w/ props: {Object} meta, {Array|Object} data, & {Object} headers

classitems.description: Store resource objects in the `data` array of the cache
classitems.name: cacheData

params.name: resp
params.description: w/ props: {Object} meta, {Array|Object} data, & {Object} headers

classitems.description: Add or update cache data
classitems.name: cacheUpdate

params.name: resp
params.description: w/ props: {Object} meta, {Array|Object} data, & {Object} headers

classitems.description: Store meta from headers on resource meta
classitems.name: cacheControl

classitems.description: Lookup a resource from cached data
classitems.name: cacheLookup

classitems.description: The service object for the entity (adapter with cache and serializer)
classitems.name: service

classitems.description: Extending Prototypes Must define a `type` value for the entity, e.g. `posts`
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Persisted resource ID value
classitems.name: id

classitems.description:
An optional `attributes` property of for a JSON API Resource object, setup in create()

This object will keep the values from the response object and may be mutable
Use this as a refence for creating computed properties

For example the `attr()` helper sets up a properties based on this content
classitems.name: attributes

classitems.description: An optional `relationships` property of for a JSON API Resource object, setup in create()
classitems.name: relationships

classitems.description: An optional `links` property of for a JSON API Resource object, setup in create()
classitems.name: links

classitems.description: An optional property of for a JSON API Resource object, setup in create()
classitems.name: meta

classitems.description: Hash of attributes for changed/previous values
classitems.name: _attributes

classitems.description: Flag for new instance, e.g. not peristed
classitems.name: isNew

classitems.description: Custom `toString` method used for clarity that the instance is a JSON API Resource kind of object
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: Adds related links object on the relationship hash
classitems.name: addRelationship

params.name: related
params.description: - resource name

classitems.description: Remove related links object on the relationship hash to have `null` data
classitems.name: removeRelationship

params.name: related
params.description: - resource name

classitems.description: Initialize events to communicate with the service object, listen for `didUpdateResource`
classitems.name: initEvents

classitems.description: Handler for `didUpdateResource` event, resets private _attributes used for changed/previous tracking
classitems.name: didUpdateResource

classitems.description: A local cache duration, to minimize duplicate fetch requests
classitems.name: cacheDuration

classitems.description:
To protect the JSON API Resource properties for attributes, links and relationships
these objects are setup during create(). This has to be defined since the attr()
helper needs to have new objects for each instance, to project from keeping a
reference on the prototype.
classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Helper to setup computed property for resource attributes
classitems.name: attr

classitems.description: Checks for required `relationship` property
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: The name of the relationship
classitems.name: resource

classitems.description: Proxy for the requested relation, resolves w/ content from fulfilled promise
classitems.name: createProxy

classitems.description: Proxy url to fetch for the resource's relation
classitems.name: proxyUrl

classitems.description: Lookup relation from service cache and pomisify result
classitems.name: promiseFromCache

classitems.description: Lookup data in service cache
classitems.name: serviceCacheLookup

classitems.description: Helper to setup a has one relationship to another resource
classitems.name: hasOne

classitems.description: Helper to setup a has many relationship to another resource
classitems.name: hasMany

classitems.description: Serialize resource for the request payload
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: resource
params.description: - object to serialize

classitems.description: Serialize a resource object
classitems.name: serializeResource

params.name: object
params.description: to serialize

classitems.description: Serialize a resource object, but only the changed attributes
classitems.name: serializeChanged

params.name: object
params.description: to serialize

classitems.description: Deserialize response objects from the request payload
classitems.name: deserialize

params.name: json
params.description: - response object, extract resource(s)

classitems.description: Deserialize response objects in the payload data
classitems.name: deserializeResources

classitems.description: Deserialize response an object in the payload data
classitems.name: deserializeResource

classitems.description: Deserialize optional included array of payload and add to service cache
classitems.name: deserializeIncluded

params.name: resp
params.description: (optional) e.g. headers, meta, etc.

classitems.description:
Create a Resource from a JSON API Resource Object

See <http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-objects>
classitems.name: _createResourceInstance

classitems.description: Find resource(s) using an id or a using a query `{id: '', query: {}}`
classitems.name: find

params.description: - the entity or resource name will be pluralized

params.name: options
params.description: (object) or id (string)

classitems.description: Access to the cached object
classitems.name: all

params.description: - the entity or resource name will be pluralized

params.name: the
params.description: resource instance to serialize

params.description: resource instance to serialize the changed attributes

Patch a relationship, either add or remove, sends a PATCH request

Adds with payload: `{ "data": { "type": "comments", "id": "12" } }`
Removes with payload: `{ "data": null }`
classitems.name: patchRelationship

params.description: - the entity or resource name will be pluralized

params.name: the
params.description: resource instance, has URLs via it's relationships property

params.name: resource
params.description: name (plural) to find the url from the resource instance

params.description: - the entity or resource name will be pluralized
